Company: BIZJET INTERNATIONAL SALES AND SUPPORT INC
BizJet International Sales and Support Inc.
Description: BizJet International Sales and Support Inc., a provider of aircraft maintenance, repair and overhaul services based in Tulsa, Okla., agreed to pay an $11.8 million criminal penalty to resolve charges related to the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act .

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: Venegas v. Global Aircraft Service Inc et al
Cruz v. Sky Chefs, Inc. et al

Agency: Transportation Department Aviation Consumer Protection Division

Description: A Sun Valley company was ordered today to pay $200,000 in fines for illegally dumping cyanide and other hazardous waste into the Los Angeles city sewer system.
Info Source: Sun Valley Company to Pay $200,000 for Dumping Waste, City News Service, December 29, 2005 (via Nexis).

Description: The Seattle Office of Labor Standards (OLS) found that LSG Sky Chefs violated Seattle's Minimum Wage Ordinance and ordered the company to pay $210,213 in lost wages plus interest to 156 employees and $109,320 in liquidated damages. OLS also levied $15,500 in penalties for first time violations and failure to cooperate with its investigation. The total amount assessed was $335,033.
